intro: Wendlandia zooi, commonly known as the pink fairy fan, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences composed of numerous small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
